question: 砕く
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>smash</kanji> and the verb vocab version of the kanji is <vocabulary>to smash</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to break</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You want <vocabulary>to smash</vocabulary> my stuff? That's <reading>coo' <ja>だ</ja></reading> (<ja>くだ</ja>). Whatever you wanna do.
